Example: Nie mam ani czasu, ani pieniędzy.
Translation: I have neither time nor money.
Notes: These adverbs express agreement, confirmation, or denial. Use when you want to affirm or deny a statement, action, or condition.

Example: Ani on, ani ona nie przyszli na spotkanie.
Translation: Neither he nor she came to the meeting.
I never did it even once.
I really like it.
He really works hard.
I really want to do it.
No, I can’t come today.
I do not want to do that.
I don’t have time for this.
I will never do that.
I have never been to Paris.
I never give up.
Indeed, that’s true.

Example: Owszem, byłem tam w zeszłym roku.
Translation: Actually, I was there last year.
Indeed, I can help you.

Example: Lubię kawę, ale lubię herbatę również.
Translation: I like coffee, but I also like tea.
He also wants to come.
We were on vacation too.
Yes, I agree with you.
Yes, that’s exactly what I was thinking.
Yes, I will do it tomorrow.

Example: Ja także chcę iść na koncert.
Translation: I also want to go to the concert.

Example: Ona także pracuje w tej firmie.
Translation: She also works in this company.
They were there as well yesterday.

Meaning: Until / As Far As / As Much As
Translation: I waited for as long as two hours.
Notes: These adverbs explain the reason or cause behind an action or event. Use when you want to indicate why something happens.

Meaning: Until / As Far As / As Much As
Translation: We walked until dusk.

Meaning: Until / As Far As / As Much As
Example: Aż się zdziwiłem, jak dobrze zdał.
Translation: I was surprised how well he passed.
He yelled at me for no reason.
He disappeared for no reason.
He’s angry for no reason.
I’m not going because it’s raining.
I can’t because I’m tired.

Example: Zostałem w domu, bo było zimno.
Translation: I stayed at home because it was cold.
I did it for you.
I work for my family.

Example: Dla dobra wszystkich musimy działać szybko.
Translation: For everyone’s good, we must act quickly.

Example: Padał deszcz, dlatego zostałem w domu.
Translation: It was raining, that’s why I stayed at home.
It was late, so I went to sleep.

Example: Nie miał pieniędzy, dlatego nie kupił biletu.
Translation: He didn’t have money, so he didn’t buy the ticket.
I have to go, since I have a meeting.

Example: Nie jadłem, gdyż nie byłem głodny.
Translation: I didn’t eat because I wasn’t hungry.
Hurry up, because time is running out.
As a result of the accident, the road was closed.
As a result of a mistake, they lost the data.
Because of the storm, flights were halted.
I instinctively pulled my hand back.
He smiled instinctively.
He closed his eyes reflexively.
He didn’t come because he was sick.
I can’t go out because I’m working.
She’s crying because she’s scared.

Example: Nie miał szans, przeto się nie starał.
Translation: He had no chance, thus he didn’t try.
There was a storm, therefore we didn’t go out.

Example: Nie miał wyjścia, przeto się zgodził.
Translation: He had no choice, so he agreed.
I was late because of him.
Everything got ruined because of the rain.

Example: Przez korki spóźniłem się na spotkanie.
Translation: Because of traffic, I was late for the meeting.
The door closed automatically.
The system shut down by itself.
The process started on its own.

Example: Spóźnił się, skutkiem tego przegapił początek.
Translation: He was late; as a result, he missed the beginning.

Example: Nie uczył się, skutkiem tego nie zdał.
Translation: He didn’t study, so he failed.
As a result, the plan was changed.
It’s raining, so take an umbrella.
I was hungry, so I ate a sandwich.

Example: Jest chory, więc nie idzie do szkoły.
Translation: He’s sick, so he’s not going to school.

Example: Nie było zajęć z powodu śniegu.
Translation: There were no classes because of the snow.
The delay was due to traffic.
I didn’t come because of illness.

Example: Z racji wieku nie może pracować.
Translation: Due to his age, he cannot work.

Example: Z racji obowiązków nie mogłem przyjechać.
Translation: Because of obligations, I couldn’t come.

Example: Z racji święta szkoła była zamknięta.
Translation: Because of the holiday, the school was closed.
For this reason, he left the city.

Example: Nie mam czasu, z tego powodu nie przyjadę.
Translation: I don’t have time; for this reason I won’t come.
For this reason, we changed the decision.

Example: Z winy kierowcy doszło do kolizji.
Translation: Because of the driver’s fault, there was a collision.

Example: Wszystko się opóźniło z winy dostawcy.
Translation: Everything was delayed due to the supplier’s fault.

Example: Z winy złej organizacji projekt się nie udał.
Translation: The project failed due to poor organization.

Example: Jest zmęczony, zatem nie pójdzie z nami.
Translation: He is tired, thus he won’t go with us.
It was late, hence we returned.

Example: Nie miał kluczy, zatem nie mógł wejść.
Translation: He didn’t have the keys, so he couldn’t enter.

Example: Ze względu na zdrowie rzuciłem palenie.
Translation: Because of my health, I quit smoking.

Example: Ze względu na pogodę odwołano mecz.
Translation: Due to the weather, the match was canceled.

Example: Ze względu na bezpieczeństwo zamknięto drogę.
Translation: For safety reasons, the road was closed.
I need more detailed information.
Notes: These adverbs indicate the intensity, extent, or level of an action, adjective, or other adverb. Use to express how much or to what degree something occurs.

Translation: I am more tired than yesterday.

Example: On jest bardziej doświadczony od mnie.
Translation: He is more experienced than me.
It is very cold outside.

Example: Bardzo mi się podoba ten film.
Translation: I like this movie very much.
Thank you very much for your help.
I eat very little.
Very few people came.
I know him very little.
This task is quite easy.
I am quite happy with the result.
You are doing quite well.
I work on the project all the time.

Example: Dzieci bawią się cały czas na podwórku.
Translation: The children play outside all the time.
I think about holidays all the time.
I partially agree.
It partially succeeded.
It was partially repaired.
That’s quite simple.
It’s fairly late.
He speaks fairly quickly.
I have a lot of work today.
There were a lot of people at the concert.
I work out a lot at the gym.
I mainly deal with programming.
The film was mainly about love.
It was mainly about money.
He studies intensely.
We worked intensively.
He thought intensely about the problem.
I hardly made it to the train.
I could scarcely hear what she said.

Example: Ledwie otworzyłem drzwi, a on już wszedł.
Translation: I barely opened the door, and he was already inside.
I barely made it to the bus.
I can barely see in the dark.
I could barely hear what he said.
He got involved to the maximum.
I work as efficiently as possible.
The waiting time was shortened to the maximum.
It changed only slightly.
He improved his results minimally.
That’s only a minimal difference.
I want to eat less sweets.

Example: Mam mniej pracy dzisiaj niż wczoraj.
Translation: I have less work today than yesterday.
Fewer people came to the party.
He was an extraordinarily talented student.
The weather was extraordinarily nice.
That was an extraordinarily difficult task.
He’s slightly better.
Something has changed slightly.
I feel somewhat tired.
I almost was late.
I almost fell down the stairs.
That was nearly impossible.
I almost forgot about the meeting.
It was nearly impossible to do it.
I nearly was late.
I have not much time.
I understand not much of this text.
Not many people came to the meeting.
I thank you enormously.
I’m tremendously happy.
I’m very interested in this.
I almost finished.
I nearly cried.
We’re almost there.
He stresses out excessively.
You care excessively about details.
Don't be excessively critical.
I like you so much.
Don’t speak so loudly.
Is it so far?
I am a little tired.
I will be a little late for the meeting.
Add a little salt to the soup.
I don't like this movie at all.
He doesn't work at all.
I don't understand this at all.
It’s exceptionally warm today.
He did exceptionally well.
She was exceptionally kind.
It’s too difficult.
He’s too confident.
He’s late too often.

Example: To jest zdecydowanie najlepszy film roku.
Translation: This is definitely the best movie of the year.
I definitely prefer tea over coffee.
She is decidedly more experienced.
Prices have risen significantly.
He significantly improved his results.
The temperature dropped significantly at night.
I completely agree with you.
That’s something completely different.
I’m entirely calm.
Maybe it will rain today.
Notes: These adverbs express uncertainty or hesitation about an action or fact. Use when you want to convey doubt or lack of certainty.

Translation: Perhaps he’ll be late.
Maybe you should rest.
I’ll probably go home earlier.
I think I made a mistake.

Example: Chyba nie ma go dziś w pracy.
Translation: I guess he’s not at work today.

Example: Pójdę na spacer, chyba że będzie padać.
Translation: I will go for a walk unless it rains.

Example: Zostanę w domu, chyba że zadzwonisz.
Translation: I’ll stay at home unless you call.

Example: Nie wyjdę, chyba że się poprawi pogoda.
Translation: I won’t go out unless the weather improves.

Example: Możemy spotkać się jutro, ewentualnie pojutrze.
Translation: We can meet tomorrow, or possibly the day after.
You can possibly try it differently.
Possibly call me.
That is possible.
It’s possible I’m wrong.
It’s possible that it will rain.

Example: Niby wszystko jest dobrze, ale coś jest nie tak.
Translation: Supposedly everything is fine, but something is wrong.

Example: On niby zna odpowiedź, ale nie jest pewien.
Translation: He supposedly knows the answer but isn’t sure.

Example: Niby miał przyjść, ale się nie pojawił.
Translation: He was supposed to come, but he didn’t show up.
He’ll probably come later.
I probably forgot my keys.
It will probably rain.
It will presumably rain.
He will presumably be late.
That is presumably so.
He was allegedly there yesterday.
He allegedly has a lot of money.
He allegedly did it himself.

Example: Zdaje się, że on jest chory.
Translation: It seems he is sick.
It seems I lost my wallet.

Example: Zdaje się, że wszystko jest w porządku.
Translation: It seems everything is okay.
You need to practice in order to get better.
Notes: These adverbs express the intention or purpose behind an action. Use when you want to explain why someone does something.

Translation: I read to learn something.
I closed the door so it would be quiet.
I did it to help you.
He wrote a letter to explain the situation.
She saved money in order to buy a car.
He said it to calm me down.
He left to rest.

Example: Wstałem wcześnie, by zdążyć na pociąg.
Translation: I got up early to catch the train.
They met for the purpose of discussing the project.
A group was formed to control quality.

Example: Szkolenie odbyło się celem poprawy umiejętności.
Translation: The training took place to improve skills.
We’re doing it for everyone’s good.
That was for the child’s good.
He stayed for the good of the team.
We’re taking steps toward that.
I see no obstacles to that.
Everything is heading toward that.
We aim to improve the results.

Example: Projekt ma na celu pomoc dzieciom.
Translation: The project aims to help children.

Example: Nasza praca ma na celu rozwój społeczny.
Translation: Our work aims at social development.
I’ve worked for that my whole life.
I don’t have money for that.
We waited a long time for that.
Why are you doing that?
Why do you need so much money?
Why go there now?
You came here for something, right?

Example: Każdy ma po coś swój plan.
Translation: Everyone has their plan for a reason.

Example: Nie robimy tego bez celu — robimy to po coś.
Translation: We’re not doing this for nothing — we’re doing it for a purpose.

Example: Przyszedłem tu po to, żeby ci pomóc.
Translation: I came here in order to help you.

Example: Uczymy się po to, żeby zdać egzamin.
Translation: We study in order to pass the exam.

Example: On pracuje po to, żeby utrzymać rodzinę.
Translation: He works in order to support his family.

Example: Po to właśnie się tu spotkaliśmy.
Translation: That’s exactly why we met here.
That’s exactly why we invited him.

Example: Po to właśnie uczymy się gramatyki.
Translation: That’s exactly why we learn grammar.
They hired an expert for this purpose.

Example: W tym celu zbudowano nowe laboratorium.
Translation: A new lab was built for this purpose.

Example: Kupił specjalny program w tym celu.
Translation: He bought special software for this purpose.

Example: Piszę ten tekst z celem informowania ludzi.
Translation: I write this text with the goal of informing people.

Example: Firma działa z celem poprawy usług.
Translation: The company operates with the goal of improving services.

Example: Prowadzimy badania z celem odkrycia leku.
Translation: We conduct research with the goal of discovering a cure.

Example: Podjęli decyzję z powodu celu projektu.
Translation: They made the decision because of the project goal.

Example: Zmienili plan z powodu celu organizacji.
Translation: They changed the plan due to the organization’s aim.

Example: Kierowali się z powodu celu poprawy jakości.
Translation: They were driven by the goal of improving quality.
He came here with the intention of talking.

Example: Wyjechała z zamiarem pracy za granicą.
Translation: She left with the intention of working abroad.
I called with the intention of inviting him.

Example: Uczę się, żeby dostać dobrą pracę.
Translation: I study so that I can get a good job.
I exercise every day to stay healthy.
I’m saving money to buy a house.

Meaning: In Order To Be Able To
Example: Muszę iść spać, żeby móc wstać wcześnie.
Translation: I have to sleep in order to wake up early.

Meaning: In Order To Be Able To
Example: Pracuję ciężko, żeby móc wyjechać na wakacje.
Translation: I work hard so I can go on vacation.

Meaning: In Order To Be Able To
Example: Uczę się, żeby móc zdać egzamin.
Translation: I study in order to pass the exam.

Example: Zrobił to, żeby tylko się wykazać.
Translation: He did it just to show off.

Example: Powiedział to, żeby tylko mnie zdenerwować.
Translation: He said that just to annoy me.

Example: Pracuje, żeby tylko zarobić na chleb.
Translation: He works just to earn a living.
They traveled safely through the mountains.
Notes: These adverbs describe how an action is performed. Use when you want to explain the way or style in which something happens.

Example: Dzieci bawiły się bezpiecznie na placu zabaw.
Translation: Children played safely on the playground.
They crossed the street safely at the crosswalk.

Example: On mieszka biednie w małym domu.
Translation: He lives poorly in a small house.

Example: Biednie ubrani ludzie czekali na ulicy.
Translation: Poorly dressed people waited on the street.

Example: Biednie radził sobie z tym zadaniem.
Translation: He handled the task miserably.
The house was richly decorated with gold.

Example: Bogato ubrane damy tańczyły na balu.
Translation: Richly dressed ladies danced at the ball.
The meal was richly spiced.
This picture looks ugly.

Example: On zachowywał się brzydko wobec przyjaciół.
Translation: He behaved unpleasantly towards his friends.
It smelled unpleasantly in the room.

Example: Dziecko spało cicho w swoim łóżku.
Translation: The child slept quietly in their bed.
Please speak quietly in the library.

Example: Kot porusza się cicho po pokoju.
Translation: The cat moves quietly around the room.
He spoke interestingly about his travels.
The film was interestingly made.
That new building looks interestingly.

Example: W pokoju było ciemno bez światła.
Translation: It was dark in the room without light.
The forest looked dark at dusk.

Example: On spojrzał ciemno na swojego rywala.
Translation: He looked darkly at his rival.
He greeted us warmly and sincerely.

Example: Dziecko tuliło się ciepło do mamy.
Translation: The child cuddled warmly to mom.
The sun shone warmly in the sky.
He worked hard all day.
He was breathing heavily after running.
It rained heavily all night.
The room is cleanly cleaned.
He speaks purely and clearly.
She performed her task cleanly.

Meaning: Long (time) / For a long time (Note: sometimes manner / time)
Translation: I waited a long time for the bus.

Meaning: Long (time) / For a long time (Note: sometimes manner / time)
Translation: We talked for a long time on the phone.

Meaning: Long (time) / For a long time (Note: sometimes manner / time)
Translation: She worked for a long time on this project.
He studies English well.
Everything went well at the meeting.
She sings very well.
He measured the table length precisely.

Example: Opisał swoje uczucia dokładnie i jasno.
Translation: He described his feelings precisely and clearly.
She completed the task precisely according to instructions.
Everything here is expensive.
He bought the car expensively.
We paid expensively for the tickets.
The animal ran wildly through the forest.
People danced wildly at the party.
Plants grow wildly in the garden.
He behaved strangely at the meeting.
It smelled strange in this room.

Example: Czułem się dziwnie po tym zdarzeniu.
Translation: I felt strange after that event.
He breathed deeply during meditation.
He slept deeply all night.
He deeply believed in his dreams.

Example: Dzieci bawiły się głośno na podwórku.
Translation: The children played loudly in the yard.
The music played loudly at the concert.
He shouted loudly on the field.
They hotly discussed politics.
The sun shone hotly at noon.
I hotly recommend this movie!

Example: To rozwiązanie pasuje idealnie do problemu.
Translation: This solution fits the problem ideally.
She completed the task ideally without errors.
The apartment is ideally furnished.
The light shines brightly in the room.
He clearly expressed his opinion.
You can clearly see stars in the sky.
The room was colorfully decorated.
He painted the picture very colorfully.
The children played dressed colorfully.
He told the story briefly and concisely.

Example: Spotkanie zakończyło się krótko przed obiadem.
Translation: The meeting ended shortly before lunch.
He explained the game rules briefly.
He easily solved this math problem.

Example: Można łatwo nauczyć się nowego języka.
Translation: You can easily learn a new language.
I easily lost the keys.

Example: Dotknij jajka lekko, żeby nie pękło.
Translation: Touch the egg lightly so it doesn’t break.
She walks lightly on the snow.
It started raining lightly.
He invests his money wisely.
Parents wisely raise their children.
It is wise to save for the future.
She spoke softly and gently.
The cat walked softly on the carpet.
Touch that material softly.

Example: Było miło spotkać się z tobą.
Translation: It was nice to meet you.
We spent a pleasant time on vacation.
It’s nice to hear such news.
It became wet after the rain.
It was wet on the floor.
He sang wetly in the shower.
He drove dangerously fast.
It is dangerous to walk on ice.

Example: Zbliżaj się niebezpiecznie do zwierząt dzikich.
Translation: Approach wild animals dangerously.
Normally, I walk to work.

Example: Dzieci normalnie bawią się na podwórku.
Translation: Children normally play in the yard.
Normally, I eat breakfast at 7 AM.
This house is furnished modernly.
The company operates modernly and efficiently.

Example: Malarz tworzy nowocześnie, używając nowych technik.
Translation: The painter works modernly using new techniques.
The lesson was boringly conducted.
It became boring at the party.
I was bored during the long trip.
The flowers grew beautifully in the garden.
She danced beautifully on stage.
This painting is beautifully painted.

Example: Oni myślą podobnie na ten temat.
Translation: They think similarly on this topic.
Both paintings look similarly.
I reacted similarly to this news.

Example: Ten zespół jest popularnie znany w Polsce.
Translation: This band is popularly known in Poland.

Example: Książka została popularnie przeczytana przez wielu.
Translation: The book was popularly read by many.

Example: Popularnie mówi się, że to najlepszy film roku.
Translation: It is popularly said that this is the best movie of the year.
I take this seriously.
He seriously considers changing jobs.
The conversation ended seriously.
This is truly an exceptional event.
I truly believe his words.
It truly changed my life.
They talked privately about their plans.

Example: Prywatnie uczę się gry na pianinie.
Translation: I privately learn to play the piano.
They met privately after work.
They talked friendly about their plans.
He greeted the guests friendly.

Example: Dzieci bawiły się przyjaźnie w parku.
Translation: The children played friendly in the park.
The wind blows strongly today.

Example: Silnie cię wspieram w tym projekcie.
Translation: I strongly support you in this project.
I feel strongly motivated.
He felt weak after the illness.
This computer works weakly.
He stands weakly on his feet.
The child sang the lullaby sweetly.
This dessert tastes sweetly.
The flowers smelled sweetly in the garden.
The dinner was really tastily prepared.
She cooks very deliciously.
The cake tasted deliciously and sweetly.
I’m sad that you’re leaving.
He looked sadly at the photo.
It was sad when we parted.
He moderately rated the exam result.

Example: Średnio wzrosły ceny w tym roku.
Translation: Prices moderately increased this year.

Example: Jest średnio wysoki jak na swój wiek.
Translation: He is moderately tall for his age.
It was terribly cold at night.
He was terribly afraid of the storm.
He had a terrible headache.
The lips were dry after running.
The air in the room is dry.
He spoke dryly, without emotion.
Freshly baked bread smells wonderful.
Freshly cut grass looks beautiful.
Freshly squeezed juice is healthy.
The river flows broadly through the valley.
He smiled broadly.
They discussed the topic widely at the conference.
I bought shoes cheaply on sale.

Example: Możesz zjeść tanio w tej restauracji.
Translation: You can eat cheaply at this restaurant.

Example: Tanio wynajmują mieszkania w tym mieście.
Translation: Apartments are rented cheaply in this city.
We traditionally celebrate Christmas.

Example: Tradycyjnie nosi się takie ubrania na weselu.
Translation: Such clothes are traditionally worn at weddings.
We traditionally eat pierogi at holidays.

Example: Trudno mu było podnieść ciężką skrzynię.
Translation: It was difficult for him to lift the heavy chest.
It is hard to say what happened.

Example: Trudno jest znaleźć czas na odpoczynek.
Translation: It is hard to find time to rest.
He hit the door hard.
He worked firmly all day.
The table stands firmly on the floor.
The passage was narrowly blocked.

Example: Droga zrobiła się wąsko między domami.
Translation: The road became narrow between houses.

Example: Wąsko się mieścimy w tym pomieszczeniu.
Translation: We fit narrowly in this room.
The children sang cheerfully in the yard.

Example: On uśmiechał się wesoło do wszystkich.
Translation: He smiled merrily at everyone.
We spent a merry time on vacation.

Example: Rozmawiał z nią wrażliwie o trudnych sprawach.
Translation: He spoke sensitively to her about difficult matters.
He reacted sensitively to criticism.

Example: Artysta postrzega świat wrażliwie i subtelnie.
Translation: The artist perceives the world sensitively and subtly.
We spent a wonderful time on vacation.
He plays the piano wonderfully.

Example: Wspaniale wykonali swój występ na scenie.
Translation: They performed wonderfully on stage.
We work jointly on this project.
Together we decided on the meeting date.
They have lived together for five years.
He sat comfortably on the sofa.
You can travel comfortably by this train.
We live comfortably in the new house.
The tree grows tall above the house.
He highly rated your work.

Example: Balon uniósł się wysoko w niebo.
Translation: The balloon rose high into the sky.
He amusingly told jokes at the party.
The movie was amusingly filmed.

Example: Dziecko śmiało się zabawnie z klauna.
Translation: The child laughed amusingly at the clown.
He works professionally as a graphic designer.
He trains professionally in football.
He professionally deals with programming.

Example: Ona je zdrowo, dużo warzyw i owoców.
Translation: She eats healthily, lots of vegetables and fruits.
He lives healthily and exercises daily.

Example: Starają się gotować zdrowo dla całej rodziny.
Translation: They try to cook healthily for the whole family.
The wind blew coldly through the window.

Example: Ona spojrzała na niego zimno i obojętnie.
Translation: She looked at him coldly and indifferently.

Example: Zimno było w tym pokoju bez ogrzewania.
Translation: It was cold in the room without heating.

Example: On grał źle w piłkę nożną.
Translation: He played football badly.
The weather is poorly forecasted today.

Example: Czuję się źle po wczorajszej imprezie.
Translation: I feel badly after yesterday’s party.
I live near the school.
Notes: These adverbs indicate the location or direction of an action. Use to specify where something happens.

Translation: There is a gas station nearby.
Come close so I can hear you.
I live far from the city center.
He traveled far.
There is a lake far from here.
Where are you going?

Example: Nie powiedział mi, dokąd się wybiera.
Translation: He didn’t tell me where he’s going.

Example: Zastanawiam się, dokąd prowadzi ta droga.
Translation: I’m wondering where this road leads.
I saw him somewhere before.
He must be somewhere nearby.
I lost it somewhere along the way.
The children are playing outside.
It’s cold outside.
We're going outside for a walk.
I can’t find it anywhere.
Nowhere has better coffee.

Example: Nigdzie nie czuję się tak dobrze jak w domu.
Translation: I feel good nowhere else like at home.
Sit next to me.
The shop is next to the post office.
Park next to that car.
Where did you come from?

Example: Nie wiem, skąd on to wie.
Translation: I don’t know where he knows it from.
Where are we supposed to get so much money from?
He lives there.
There is a grocery store there.
Don’t go there alone.
You can sit here.
I've lived here for years.
Leave it here, please.
Go down the stairs.
Look down.
The ball rolled down.
Look up at the ceiling.
We went up the hill.
The airplane flew upward.
Turn left at the intersection.

Example: On siedzi w lewo ode mnie.
Translation: He is sitting to the left of me.
Look to the left.
Turn right at the lights.

Example: Drzwi są w prawo od windy.
Translation: The door is to the right of the elevator.
Look to the right.
He is sitting in the middle of the room.
There was a bookmark inside the book.
The car is inside the garage.
Stay inside, please.
It's warm inside.
Look inside the box.
I looked for him everywhere.
There are people everywhere.
His books are everywhere.
There's a garden in front of the building.
I sit at the front of the classroom.
The car has lights in front.
The car is behind the building.

Example: Z tyłu jest jeszcze jedno wejście.
Translation: There is another entrance in the back.
I saw something behind the car.
Sometimes it snows in April.
Notes: These adverbs tell when an action takes place or how often. Use to indicate the timing or frequency of an event.

Translation: Sometimes I like to be alone.
Sometimes I cook dinner.
I often go for walks.
He makes mistakes often.
We meet quite often.
I haven’t seen you in a long time.
I lived here long ago.
That was a long time ago.
He just arrived now.
I just woke up.

Example: Film zaczyna się dopiero o ósmej.
Translation: The movie starts not until eight.
I have a lot of work today.
We're going to the cinema today.
The weather is beautiful today.
I have a meeting tomorrow.
We're going on vacation tomorrow.
It will rain tomorrow.
I’ve already finished.
I’m here already.
I already know him.
I once lived in Kraków.
Maybe we’ll go there someday.
It used to be easier.
Suddenly it got dark.
Suddenly the phone rang.
He suddenly disappeared.
I need you immediately.
He returned home immediately.
Do it right now!
We’ll talk later.
I’ll call later.
We’ll do it later.
I didn’t know about it before.
We were there earlier.
I used to work in a bank before.
I can't talk right now.
I'm at home now.
Now everything has changed.
I should have come earlier.
It was different before.
We met earlier.
I was at the doctor yesterday.
We met yesterday.
I didn’t have time yesterday.
We’ll see each other soon.
I’ll explain everything shortly.
The movie will start soon.
I was young then.
What were you doing at that time?
That’s when we met.
I'll be right back.
We’re starting in a moment.
I’ll tell you in a second.
I always drink coffee in the morning.
You’re always late.
He always helps others.

Example: To jest bez wątpienia najlepszy film.
Translation: This is without a doubt the best movie.
Notes: These adverbs express the speaker’s attitude toward the action or statement, such as certainty, necessity, or possibility. Use to convey modality — how the speaker feels about the likelihood, necessity, or manner of the action.

Translation: Without a doubt, he is very talented.

Example: Bez wątpienia będziemy się dobrze bawić.
Translation: Without a doubt, we will have fun.

Example: Co więcej, mam dla ciebie prezent.
Translation: Moreover, I have a gift for you.

Example: Co więcej, udało mi się to zrobić szybko.
Translation: Moreover, I managed to do it quickly.
Moreover, we invited all our friends.
By the way, have you seen the new movie?
By the way, I forgot to tell you.
By the way, the meeting is at 6 PM.
I will definitely arrive on time.
He definitely likes this music.
He is definitely at home.
Apparently, he got lost.
Apparently, he didn’t hear the phone.
Apparently, it’s a good idea.
Unfortunately, I can’t come.
Unfortunately, we ran out of money.
Unfortunately, it didn’t work out.
This is undoubtedly important.
He undoubtedly has talent.
That will undoubtedly help.
Of course, I will help you.
Obviously, I will do it.
Of course, you’re right.
Similarly to you, I like coffee.
I think similarly about this problem.
I did similarly recently.
Reportedly, it will rain tomorrow.
Allegedly, she is very smart.
Reportedly, he won the contest.

Example: Tak naprawdę nie wiem, co myśleć.
Translation: Actually, I don’t know what to think.

Example: Tak naprawdę to nie ma znaczenia.
Translation: Actually, it doesn’t matter.
I really like this song.

Example: W rzeczywistości nie jest tak źle.
Translation: In reality, it’s not that bad.

Example: W rzeczywistości to było trudniejsze niż myślałem.
Translation: In reality, it was harder than I thought.
In reality, everything works well.
Overall, it was quite good.

Example: W sumie nie mam nic przeciwko.
Translation: Basically, I have nothing against it.
Overall, I agree.
Actually, I don’t know.
Really, I didn’t have time.
Actually, you’re right.
I will certainly do that.
That is certainly true.
I will certainly agree.
He is surely on the way.
He presumably forgot about the meeting.
He will surely be late.

Example: Zdaniem mnie to nie jest dobre rozwiązanie.
Translation: In my opinion, this is not a good solution.
In my opinion, you should rest.
In my opinion, this is important.

Example: Nie chcę iść, zresztą jestem zmęczony.
Translation: I don’t want to go, besides, I’m tired.

Example: Zresztą to nie jest takie ważne.
Translation: Anyway, it’s not that important.

Example: Zresztą nie mam czasu na to.
Translation: Besides, I don’t have time for that.
I am also going to the cinema.
He also likes music.
We also want to try.
Even children understand that.
He didn’t even say a word.
It will even rain tomorrow.
I will rather go for a walk.

Example: To raczej nie jest dobry pomysł.
Translation: That is rather not a good idea.
He is rather tired.
I am still waiting for the bus.

Example: Ona wciąż mieszka w tym samym domu.
Translation: She still lives in the same house.
He is still working on the project.
I haven’t finished yet.
Do you still have questions?

Example: Jeszcze jest czas, aby się przygotować.
Translation: There is still time to prepare.
You must do it differently.
He thinks differently than you.
Everything went differently than planned.
I usually go to sleep at 10 p.m.
It usually rains here in autumn.
We usually work from 9 to 5.
I like fruits, especially apples.

Example: To jest ważne, zwłaszcza dla dzieci.
Translation: This is important, especially for children.
Especially in winter it’s cold.
Maybe we will go for a walk.
Maybe he will be late.
Maybe tomorrow will be nice weather.
He will certainly come to the meeting.
That is certain.
We will certainly find a solution.
It’s already late.
I woke up late.
We started work late.
I speak slowly so you understand.
The car is driving slowly.
I learn new things slowly.
He runs very quickly.
We must act quickly.
The train goes quickly.
I woke up early in the morning.
The meeting was early.
Children go to bed early.
The hands are dirty after work.
The apartment is dirty.
It’s dirty in the kitchen after cooking.
It’s raining again.
He was late again.
We are starting again.
I have only one question.
It’s only a game.
I just want to rest.
I have enough money.
That is good enough.
I worked long enough.
We helped each other mutually.
We act mutually for the benefit.
We understand each other mutually.
